data_center.context: Includes 4th Gen EPYC™ server processors and related data center products

drivers: Strong sales of 4th Gen EPYC™ CPUs

gen4_epyc.performance_improvement: Up to 1.9 times more performance in enterprise and cloud applications
gen4_epyc.impact: Nearly doubled revenue sequentially with accelerated adoption

instinct_mi300.performance_improvement: World's most advanced accelerators for generative AI
instinct_mi300.impact: On track for volume production to support deployments with HPC, cloud, and AI customers
instinct_mi300.status: Sampling to leading HPC, Cloud, and AI customers

drivers: Decline in adaptive SoC data center product sales

spartan_ultrascale_fpgas.impact: Addressing cost-optimized, industrial, computer vision, healthcare, and robotics applications

client.context: Includes desktop and notebook PC processors and chipsets

drivers: Higher sales of Ryzen™ 7000 Series PC processors
Increased demand for Ryzen AI on-chip accelerators

ryzen_series.performance_improvement: Leadership performance and energy efficiency with dedicated AI engine
ryzen_series.impact: Significantly grew CPU sales with new notebook launches

am5_platform.impact: Supports the launch of Ryzen 7000 Series processors and new commercial PC platforms

threadripper_pro.impact: Unmatched performance for multi-threaded professional applications

gaming.context: Includes discrete graphics processors and semi-custom game console products

drivers: Decline in semi-custom revenue due to console cycle

so_c_sales.impact: Driven by improved console demand from Microsoft and Sony despite overall decline

graphics.context: Partially offset by increased Radeon™ GPU sales

rdna_3.performance_improvement: Enhanced performance and performance per watt
rdna_3.future_plans: Launch of new enthusiast-class Radeon 7000 series GPUs in Q4 2023

embedded.context: Includes Xilinx embedded products and other adaptive computing solutions

drivers: Decrease in revenue in the communications market
Inventory correction at customers in several end markets

industrial_vision_healthcare.impact: Increased demand for advanced compute capabilities and new Vitis AI software libraries

automotive.impact: Deployments of adaptive silicon solutions for high-end ADAS and AI features, e.g., Subaru's AMD-based iSIGHT platform

communications.impact: Softness due to some operators slowing infrastructure upgrades

test_emulation.impact: Launch of Versal™ Premium VP1902 and Spartan™ UltraScale+™ FPGAs enhancing adaptive computing solutions

new_adaptive_products.description: Versal™ Premium VP1902 Adaptive SoC and Spartan™ UltraScale+™ FPGAs
new_adaptive_products.impact: Expanding AMD’s adaptive computing product leadership

total_expenses.context: Operating expenses including R&D, marketing, amortization of intangible assets, and acquisition-related costs
key_factors: Higher R&D investments to support AI growth opportunities
Higher operating expenses to scale the business

R&D.context: Increased investments in research and development to support product roadmaps and AI initiatives

marketing.context: Enhanced go-to-market activities to support product launches and growth initiatives

amortization.context: Amortization of intangible assets associated with acquisitions

acquisition_related_costs.context: Costs related to strategic acquisitions, including Xilinx and Nod.ai

net_income.context: Net income not explicitly detailed for Q3 2023

eps.context: Diluted earnings per share for Q3 2023
eps.notes: Includes better-than-expected revenue and operating expenses

tax_rate.context: Effective tax rate for Q3 2023 and full year 2023

free_cash_flow.notes: Includes strategic investments and stock repurchases

cash_from_operations.notes: Reflects strong financial model despite mixed demand environment

share_repurchase.context: Repurchased $511 million of common stock during Q3 2023

full_year_2023.revenue_growth_year_over_year: Expected based on roadmaps and strategic priorities
full_year_2023.context: Led by growth in Embedded and Data Center segments

product_introductions: Enhanced Vivado™ and Vitis™ software platforms
Versal™ Premium VP1902 Adaptive SoC with on-chip HBM memory
Space-grade Versal SoC with enhanced AI Engine
partnerships_and_adoptions: Meta deploying Bergamo across global data centers
Dell, Lenovo, Super Micro launching new Bergamo platforms
Microsoft Azure launching Genoa-X HPC instances
Alibaba and Oracle Cloud expanding Pensando DPU deployments
MAX Plug Society's supercomputer in the EU powered by AMD
Hugging Face optimizing models for AMD platforms
ecosystem_support: Expanded ROCm software stack with support for PyTorch, TensorFlow, Onyx, OpenAI Triton
Collaborations with major AI software and cloud providers
Hugging Face models regularly updated and validated for Instinct accelerators
Strategic acquisitions of Mipsology and Nod.ai to enhance AI software capabilities
corporate_responsibility: Investments in sustainable technological and scientific advancements
Support for community initiatives amidst COVID-19

operating_environment_challenges: Substantial inventory reduction across the PC supply chain

executive_comments.ceo_statement: “We delivered strong revenue and earnings growth driven by demand for our Ryzen 7000 series PC processors and record server processor sales,” said AMD Chair and CEO Dr. Lisa Su. “Our data center business is on a significant growth trajectory based on the strength of our EPYC CPU portfolio and the ramp of Instinct MI300 accelerator shipments to support multiple deployments with hyperscale, enterprise and AI customers.”
executive_comments.cfo_statement: “We executed well in the third quarter, delivering year-over-year growth in revenue, gross margin and earnings per share,” said AMD EVP, CFO and Treasurer Jean Hu. “In the fourth quarter, we expect to see strong growth in Data Center and continued momentum in Client, partially offset by lower sales in the Gaming segment and additional softening of demand in the embedded markets.”
